Instruction: Combine flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon in a bowl; then stir in the walnuts.

Cream butter and brown sugar together using an electric mixer in a separate large bowl until fluffy. Mix in honey, egg, and vanilla extract until thoroughly blended. Gently stir in the flour mixture into the honey mixture until well combined. Chill dough for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease baking sheets lightly or line with parchment paper.
Form 1 tablespoon of dough into a ball for each cookie and place them on the prepared baking sheets.

Bake in the preheated oven until the cookies are slightly puffy or slightly flat in the middle for a gooey texture, approximately 8 to 10 minutes. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheets for about 5 minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.
This recipe does not taste good with buckwheat honey.
